text: To confirm the role of <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in regulation of <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity , we silenced their translation via RNA interference .

Functionality of the siRNAs directed against <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was confirmed by western blot analysis : protein levels of <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as well as the long and short isoforms of <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were strongly reduced in the presence of 150 or 300 ng specific siRNA ( Figure 7A ) .

text: An unspecific control siRNA had no influence ( Figure 7A ) .

We then cotransfected the <extra_id_0> luciferase reporter plasmid containing the 180 bp A3G promoter <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> together with 100 ng siRNA using an optimized protocol for the cotransfection of plasmid plus siRNA .

text: This resulted in a 31-43 % reduction of luciferase activity in the presence of <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - or <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific siRNA compared to the control siRNA .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation siRNA <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme Sp1 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation siRNA <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme Sp3 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: In contrast , no influence on transcriptional activity of the 150 bp fragment , which does not contain the Sp1 / Sp3 - binding motif , was observed .

Thus , both <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> factors are mediating transcriptional activity of the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
